dataJson.description: A project built for freecodecamp.com in 2016, the requirement then were to build a Night life coordination app. The API has an error since recently and may not work as it did before
dataJson.name: A Nightlife Coordination App
dataJson.story: Compared to the Voting App this was like a walk in the park. Basically pull data from the Foursquare API, and use that data locally. The only thing that I do not like is that every time you click that you are going, all the results get re rendered. Basically there is an  array of results (bars and locals that serve drinks) that are mapped to a react Component. Every time a user want to go to a bar, the database is updated with that user, so the database changes.  Now Meteor detects the change and so the array changes and it gets re rendered. It is not really noticeable, as React doeas a great job at rendering, but still. Overall an easier project.
